de.ralleytn.simple.audio

Class Recorder

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.ralleytn.simple.audio.Recorder

  • public class Recorder
extends java.lang.Object
    Records audio from an input device.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Version:
    1.2.2
    Author:
    Ralph Niemitz/RalleYTN(ralph.niemitz@gmx.de)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Recorder()
      Initializes the Recorder with FileFormat.WAV and an audio format with AudioFormat.Encoding#PCM_SIGNED, a sample rate of 44100.0F, a sample size of 16, 2 channels, a frame size of 4, a frame rate of 44100 and little endian.
      Recorder(FileFormat fileFormat, javax.sound.sampled.AudioFormat audioFormat) 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      long getRecordingTime() 
      boolean isRunning() 
      void start(java.io.File output)
      Starts the recording and writes the data in the given file.
      void start(java.io.OutputStream output)
      Starts the recording and writes the data on the given output stream.
      void stop()
      Stops the recording.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Recorder

        public Recorder()
         throws AudioException
        Initializes the Recorder with FileFormat.WAV and an audio format with AudioFormat.Encoding#PCM_SIGNED, a sample rate of 44100.0F, a sample size of 16, 2 channels, a frame size of 4, a frame rate of 44100 and little endian.
        Throws:
        AudioException - if something went wrong while initializing the recorder
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • Recorder

        public Recorder(FileFormat fileFormat,
                javax.sound.sampled.AudioFormat audioFormat)
         throws AudioException
        Parameters:
        fileFormat - the file format to use
        audioFormat - the audio format to use
        Throws:
        AudioException - if something went wrong while initializing the recorder
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • start

        public void start(java.io.File output)
           throws AudioException
        Starts the recording and writes the data in the given file.
        Parameters:
        output - the file to which the data will be written
        Throws:
        AudioException - if the line cannot be opened due to resource restrictions
        Since:
        1.2.2

      • start

        public void start(java.io.OutputStream output)
           throws AudioException
        Starts the recording and writes the data on the given output stream.
        Parameters:
        output - the output stream to write the data on
        Throws:
        AudioException - if the line cannot be opened due to resource restrictions
        Since:
        1.1.0

      • getRecordingTime

        public long getRecordingTime()
        Returns:
